  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT_DATA_VERSION

      public static final int DEFAULT_DATA_VERSION
      The default chunk data version used when no custom version is supplied.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • MCAFile

      public MCAFile​(int regionX, int regionZ)
      MCAFile represents a world save file used by Minecraft to store world data on the hard drive. This constructor needs the x- and z-coordinates of the stored region, which can usually be taken from the file name r.x.z.mca
      Parameters:
      regionX - The x-coordinate of this region.
      regionZ - The z-coordinate of this region.

  • Method Details

    • deserialize

      public void deserialize​(RandomAccessFile raf) throws IOException
      Reads an .mca file from a RandomAccessFile into this object. This method does not perform any cleanups on the data.
      Parameters:
      raf - The RandomAccessFile to read from.
      Throws:
      IOException - If something went wrong during deserialization.

    • deserialize

      public void deserialize​(RandomAccessFile raf, long loadFlags) throws IOException
      Reads an .mca file from a RandomAccessFile into this object. This method does not perform any cleanups on the data.
      Parameters:
      raf - The RandomAccessFile to read from.
      loadFlags - A logical or of LoadFlags constants indicating what data should be loaded
      Throws:
      IOException - If something went wrong during deserialization.

    • serialize

      public int serialize​(RandomAccessFile raf) throws IOException
      Calls serialize(RandomAccessFile, boolean) without updating any timestamps.
      Parameters:
      raf - The RandomAccessFile to write to.
      Returns:
      The amount of chunks written to the file.
      Throws:
      IOException - If something went wrong during serialization.
      See Also:
      serialize(RandomAccessFile, boolean)

    • serialize

      public int serialize​(RandomAccessFile raf, boolean changeLastUpdate) throws IOException
      Serializes this object to an .mca file. This method does not perform any cleanups on the data.
      Parameters:
      raf - The RandomAccessFile to write to.
      changeLastUpdate - Whether it should update all timestamps that show when this file was last updated.
      Returns:
      The amount of chunks written to the file.
      Throws:
      IOException - If something went wrong during serialization.

    • setChunk

      public void setChunk​(int index, Chunk chunk)
      Set a specific Chunk at a specific index. The index must be in range of 0 - 1023.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the Chunk.
      chunk - The Chunk to be set.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is not in the range.

    • setChunk

      public void setChunk​(int chunkX, int chunkZ, Chunk chunk)
      Set a specific Chunk at a specific chunk location. The x- and z-value can be absolute chunk coordinates or they can be relative to the region origin.
      Parameters:
      chunkX - The x-coordinate of the Chunk.
      chunkZ - The z-coordinate of the Chunk.
      chunk - The chunk to be set.

    • getChunk

      public Chunk getChunk​(int index)
      Returns the chunk data of a chunk at a specific index in this file.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the chunk in this file.
      Returns:
      The chunk data.

    • getChunk

      public Chunk getChunk​(int chunkX, int chunkZ)
      Returns the chunk data of a chunk in this file.
      Parameters:
      chunkX - The x-coordinate of the chunk.
      chunkZ - The z-coordinate of the chunk.
      Returns:
      The chunk data.

    • getChunkIndex

      public static int getChunkIndex​(int chunkX, int chunkZ)
      Calculates the index of a chunk from its x- and z-coordinates in this region. This works with absolute and relative coordinates.
      Parameters:
      chunkX - The x-coordinate of the chunk.
      chunkZ - The z-coordinate of the chunk.
      Returns:
      The index of this chunk.

    • setBiomeAt

      @Deprecated public void setBiomeAt​(int blockX, int blockZ, int biomeID)
      Deprecated.
      Use setBiomeAt(int, int, int, int) instead

    • setBiomeAt

      public void setBiomeAt​(int blockX, int blockY, int blockZ, int biomeID)

    • getBiomeAt

      @Deprecated public int getBiomeAt​(int blockX, int blockZ)
      Deprecated.
      Use getBiomeAt(int, int, int) instead

    • getBiomeAt

      public int getBiomeAt​(int blockX, int blockY, int blockZ)
      Fetches the biome id at a specific block.
      Parameters:
      blockX - The x-coordinate of the block.
      blockY - The y-coordinate of the block.
      blockZ - The z-coordinate of the block.
      Returns:
      The biome id if the chunk exists and the chunk has biomes, otherwise -1.

    • setBlockStateAt

      public void setBlockStateAt​(int blockX, int blockY, int blockZ, CompoundTag state, boolean cleanup)
      Set a block state at a specific block location. The block coordinates can be absolute coordinates or they can be relative to the region.
      Parameters:
      blockX - The x-coordinate of the block.
      blockY - The y-coordinate of the block.
      blockZ - The z-coordinate of the block.
      state - The block state to be set.
      cleanup - Whether the Palette and the BLockStates should be recalculated after adding the block state.

    • getBlockStateAt

      public CompoundTag getBlockStateAt​(int blockX, int blockY, int blockZ)
      Fetches a block state at a specific block location. The block coordinates can be absolute coordinates or they can be relative to the region.
      Parameters:
      blockX - The x-coordinate of the block.
      blockY - The y-coordinate of the block.
      blockZ - The z-coordinate of the block.
      Returns:
      The block state or null if the chunk or the section do not exist.

    • cleanupPalettesAndBlockStates

      public void cleanupPalettesAndBlockStates()
      Recalculates the Palette and the BlockStates of all chunks and sections of this region.
